Stem: Alpha Standardized Science G7.5 Created By STC 2 The mountain ranges found in Argentina in South America and Ghana in Africa have the same age and rock strata. The shapes of the two continents seem to fit into each other like two puzzle pieces when lined up next to one another. What can be concluded from this evidence?
Choices: A) that the two continents have coastlines with similar climates, B) that the mountain ranges on the two continents have the same elevation, C) that the mountain ranges on the two continents were formed at the same time, D) that the two continents were once connected but their plates later drifted apart
Scenario Justification: Real-world context with meaningful setup. Requires some application.
SEP Justification: Requires constructing explanations or engaging in argumentation.
DCI Justification: DCI present but used at surface level — identification rather than reasoning.
CCC Justification: Structure-function relationship implicitly present.
Key Recommendation: Push beyond recall — require students to reason with science ideas, not just identify them.

Stem: Data transmission occurs using both analog and digital signals. Analog signals consist of continuous waves whereas digital signals are discrete, or made up of several separate parts. The greater the distortion, the lesser the quality of data is transmitted by the wave. The image shows how a digital and analog signal mixes with a noise wave during transmission. Stem: 19 A student wants to learn what factors play an important role in collision of an object. To study the effects he prepared a car prototype and glued a hard boiled egg on the driver's seat. Then he applied a force on the car and pushed it towards a wall. He observed that when the car hit the wall, the egg fell forward and cracked. Complete the table describing the changes in the design of the car that would help prevent the cracking of the egg. DRAG & DROP THE ANSWER Use a bigger egg or a smaller seat so the egg remains fixed. Do not fix the egg to the seat with glue. Make the bumper smaller. Fix the egg to the seat with an elastic belt. Neighbors have noticed an increase in the number of frogs in the area. They know their local ecosystem will be
Scenario Justification: Real-world context with visual information. Some reasoning required.
SEP Justification: Uses a model but at mechanical/reading level, not for sense-making.
DCI Justification: Requires applying science understanding in context, beyond simple recall.
CCC Justification: Cause and effect implicitly engaged but not explicitly required for reasoning.
Key Recommendation: Require students to engage in a science practice (analyze data, construct explanation, argue from evidence).

Stem: Neighbors have noticed an increase in the number of frogs in the area. They know their local ecosystem will be affected by this change. They decide to release some snakes in their neighborhood. Based on the food web below, predict how the local ecosystem will be affected by this change. Select all of the possible outcomes.
Choices: A) The number of rabbits would decrease, B) The number of frogs and bugs would decrease., C) The number of birds and rabbits would increase., D) The number of frogs would increase with an increase in snakes. E The number of frogs would decrease, and the birds would increase F The number of bugs would increase as the number of frogs decreased The diagram represents the structures of the same compound in different phases of matter.
Scenario Justification: Real-world scenario with visual component provides some context for reasoning.
SEP Justification: Requires prediction based on understanding — applies practice in context.
DCI Justification: Requires applying science understanding in context, beyond simple recall.
CCC Justification: Multiple CCCs implicitly engaged through the reasoning required.
Key Recommendation: Good question. Consider adding more complexity through novel data or multi-step reasoning.

Stem: E The number of frogs would decrease, and the birds would increase F The number of bugs would increase as the number of frogs decreased The diagram represents the structures of the same compound in different phases of matter. Which statement about the samples is true?
Choices: A) If enough thermal energy is added to Sample 3 gaseous, the molecules will move farther apart as in Sample 1 solid., B) If enough thermal energy is added to Sample 2 liquid, the molecules will move closer together as in Sample 1 solid., C) If enough thermal energy is removed from Sample 3 gaseous, the molecules will move closer together as in Sample 2 liquid., D) If enough thermal energy is removed from Sample 2 liquid, the molecules will move farther apart as in Sample 3 gaseous. In the last few months, a local community has been working hard to rid their ocean beach and swimming area of trash
Scenario Justification: Visual provided but limited scenario context. Somewhat guided.
SEP Justification: Uses a model but at mechanical/reading level, not for sense-making.
DCI Justification: Some content engagement in answer choices but limited reasoning with DCI.
CCC Justification: Multiple CCCs implicitly engaged through the reasoning required.
Key Recommendation: Add a real-world phenomenon or puzzling scenario that students need to figure out. Require students to engage in a science practice (analyze data, construct explanation, argue from evidence).

Stem: Sample 3 gaseous. In the last few months, a local community has been working hard to rid their ocean beach and swimming area of trash and contaminants. Which cause and effect relationship describes the change in the marine life population size?
Choices: A) The increase in animals causes the water to be cleaner., B) The decrease in animals causes the water to be cleaner., C) The cleaner water causes the animal survival rate to increase., D) The cleaner water causes the animal survival rate to decrease. 40 The food that plants produce during photosynthesis is . a glucose DNA water oxygen Answer Key of Alpha Standardized Science G7.5 1. D 2. B 3. C 4. B 5. D 6. D 7. a. recycling of the water used in the farms 8. A 9. A 10. B 11. Tech Enhanced Item 12. a. sugar and oxygen 13. C 14. B 15. B 16. B 17. D 18. B 19. Tech Enhanced Item 20. C 21. C 22. C 23. C 24. C 25. Tech Enhanced Item 26. C 27. C 28. C 29. C 30. A 31. C 32. Tech Enhanced Item 33. A 34. A 35. a. Living things; b. cells 36. A 37. A, E, F 38. C 39. C 40. a. glucose
Scenario Justification: Real-world context with meaningful setup. Requires some application.
SEP Justification: No science practice engaged. Recall/identification only.
DCI Justification: DCI present but used at surface level — identification rather than reasoning.
CCC Justification: CCC explicitly engaged and required for sense-making. Multiple CCCs involved.
Key Recommendation: Require students to engage in a science practice (analyze data, construct explanation, argue from evidence). Push beyond recall — require students to reason with science ideas, not just identify them.
